< text>
The google reviews are misleading. Check the Yelp reviews for a true rating on this complex.

Review from aug 2020.. didn‚Äôt originally post.

I‚Äôd give 0 stars if I could. I am a current tenant, and cannot wait to move. Sitting in a hot, miserable apartment, and still paying $250 to MID and $80 to PGE. I have complained about the AC several times now, all without resolution. I have even offered to pay for an AC company out of my own pocket to look at the unit, but was ignored. My apartment on a 100+ day doesn‚Äôt cool below 90F, on a 90F-99F day it doesn‚Äôt cool below 84F. I open all the windows I can at night, but due to the setup, there is no cross breeze so it doesn‚Äôt cool.
Beyond the AC which is making this place a miserable, the apartment design is just not very functional. Hardly any cabinet space in the kitchen, yet the bathroom is so large you can fit an air mattress in it if you wanted. Better design would be to move the laundry into the ridiculously large bathroom and make the laundry closet a pantry space.
Additionally, all of the towel racks on the walls in the bathrooms keep falling off the wall because they are just drilled into the drywall, not into a stud.
The dumpster bins are constantly full from what appears to be illegal dumping. There is frequently homeless folks or wanderers dumpster diving. Also, everyone is careless and fills the organics dumpster with non-organics.
There are some bad pet owners as well who do not pick up after their pets.
Additionally, the apartment doesn‚Äôt turn on the outside lighting for some reason so it‚Äôs really dark at night (hallways are on, but lighting for sidewalks is not).

Normally I don‚Äôt get this way, however, I am working from home so am forced to be here 24/7, sit in a hot box, and pay a load for it. This apartment is not worth the money, I am specifically referring to my own experience in building E, a dynasty unit.

Also, not sure if it‚Äôs telling, but 4/9 units in my ‚Äúwing‚Äù have moved out within the 10 months that I‚Äôve lived here... that‚Äôs a high turnover rate.

I would not recommend to my worst enemy, and plan to move as soon as the lease is up.< /text>

<name>Suhail Halai</name><Date>1592955688132<//Date><rating>5<//rating><text>I have lived here for over four months. This is one of the nicer apartment complexes in Modesto, away from downtown, yet it only takes 10-12 minutes to get on the highway. Excellent location, convenient to shopping, groceries and restaurants. The management staff is professional and goes over and beyond to meet the needs of their residents. You can pay your rent online which makes it quite convenient. An insider tip: since it is not possible to autopay a variable amount monthly, I found it easier to just set up autopay with $50 extra to account for monthly variances in the water, garbage bill, etc. It all gets captured nicely and you can adjust the amount in your final month's rent payment when you are ready to move out.< /text>< pictures>

<user_id>103354922969396769840<//user_id><username>J Delcid< /username>< Date>

< Rating>

<review>Apartments are in a great neighborhood. I walk with my dog 3-4 miles a day, by myself, at different hours and always feel safe. There are quite a few nice parks located in the surrounding neighborhoods. The shopping center across the street is convenient. The apartment is clean and rooms are large, although the kitchen is rather small for us. The office and maintenance staff are wonderful. I have been in contact with Juan in the front office the most and he is AMAZING! We relocated from the mid-west and had to do the entire leasing process from afar and Juan was so patient and helpful through every step. Once we moved in, he continued to be helpful, courteous, and professional and takes his customer service to the next level. The maintenance crew is always very friendly and helpful, as well. The entire staff here is always hard at work whenever I see them.
A few things to keep in mind if you are considering Brooks Landing: the apartments are located on the far East side of town, so the freeway and some of the major shopping is about 15-20 minutes away. If you are commuting this may be something to consider. The closest major shopping is actually in Riverbank, which is only about ten minutes away. We are on the ground floor and can definitely hear the neighbors above us. We can hear them walking, closing cabinets and drawers, using the restroom, hear their phones go off, etc. which cannot really be helped. We did complain about other sound disturbances and the front office was very understanding and sent notices. It has not resolved all the issues, but that's just apartment living, I guess.
We only lived here for a few months while we were transitioning and we felt welcomed and safe. Over all, I highly recommend.</review>< Pictures>
None</Pictures>

<Review>My boyfriend and I had a pleasant experience living at Brooks Landing Apartments for 7 years and can't say enough about the communal area and how beautiful and well maintained it was. We had a spacious 2 bedroom apartment on the third floor with a gorgeous view overlooking pine trees. We took advantage of the rec room and gym several times. The entire staff was always very helpful and accommodating. The seldom times we had maintenance issues, the team responded quickly. The location is one of the best features. Safe neighborhood and a great shopping center across the street. Our little family has extended with one on the way, and we just need more room now. We're quite saddened to put our 30 days notice in. To be leaving a place that is so well loved and looked after. We enjoyed living here and hope whomever gets as much joy from living here as we have.</Review>< name>
Denise Winsor</name>

<Review>I have lived here for 2 years and the only reason I made it this long is because of the schools.  It is pricey, which I don't mind paying but I don't see what the extra costs are for.  They claim to have security, but people have complained about their cars being broken into on several occasions.   I have seen the night security officer drive through on occasion but never stop.  I've seen him drive by illegally parked cars.  My truck was towed from a legal spot during the day, while other vehicles are parked in the red zone or next to the "No Parking" signs and yet nothing is done.  The inconsistencies in their policies are ridiculous.  I have received two separate notices stating that I need to inform them in writing if I will not be renewing my lease.  One says 30 days before and one says 60 days before.  The lease says that you cannot have your vehicle parked in an open spot for more than 3 days, yet I got a notice saying it was 48 hours and then was told by the front office to my face that it was 24 hours.  There is dog feces everywhere and even though they warn people, they never do anything about it.  I have had the AC in my unit fixed 3 times since I've been there and though they do get to it quickly, why does it keep breaking down?  There are spots around the campus that are very dark that all they would need to do to make them safer is replace a light bulb.  They have been out for the 2 years that I've lived there.  Recently. they left water heaters sitting outside the apartments in 2 of the levels in one of the building for a little over a month.  I thought I was in the ghetto again.  People leave their trash outside their doors and nothing is said.  The office people don't return emails.  On at least 3 occasions I have had to send the same email two or three times just to get a response.  On one occasion, the response didn't even answer the question.  This place could be really nice with better management.  I think it could be one of the best in Modesto, but the people running it are lazy and incompetent.<//Review>< pictures>
None</pictures>

<Date>1489429642995< /Date><GmapID>0x80c329f9ceee8839:0x9959ed4530d40034</GmapID><Rating>3<//Rating><username>Anne Sanchez</username><Text>Plenty of free parking, located outside of Island Pacific . Restaurant itself is pretty small , so very difficult to accommodate a large party. You may need to call in advance to reserve a section, so they can maybe accommodate the party.
We decided to order the largest package menu, and we were in a table that was good for  6 . We did not have enough room for all the food, the dish wear and so on and so forth.
They do give plenty of food for the price of the package, so if you want to have large amount of food for a reasonable price .
For the items that I did try  , it was good but not the best in my opinion . The dishes though that had a soup base to them , was a bit too oily for my liking so I did not try them out .
I think they could improve, having maybe a bit more smaller dishes . It is very difficult when their is not enough space to eat .</Text><Response>None<//Response><user_id>118281557800896336091<//user_id><Pics>None<//Pics></record></dataset><record>
< review>
Good food, disappointing service. Crispy pata was very good, although my friend insists you can get it much better elsewhere. I enjoyed there kare kare, but it does not have a strong peanut flavor like it does at other places. Kind of mild, but i thought it was ok. Drinks were good & authentic (by the way, no alcoholic beverages served here). For appetisers i had the mussels - very strong roasted garlic flavor. A bit too strong for me, but others may prefer that.

Some of the workers were polite, though not friendly. One person was a little rude. That was disappointing.

Yes, i would say it's kind of expensive here. 4 food items (package deal) plus drinks was appx. $90! But it was a lot of food. Lots to take home.

Food was served up nice and hot and very fast. Very short wait. Lots of parking available - not as crowded as the Seafood City lot across the street.

All in all, it was a good dinner, but wish they were still as good as they used to be.< /review>

< review>
Repeatedly, the food here NOT good. Ordered traditional kare kare to go and first off, the order did not include bagoong. So had to drive back to get it. When we finally started eating, this dish was bland with no flavor and no distinguishing kare kare taste. How can such a well known Filipino restaurant for this dish continually serve this kind of c$&#? This isn't the first time, second, third, or fourth time I've ordered it with each time getting worse in taste. Wanted to give it a chance before putting up a review and now I felt a review is necessary before anyone else spends their hard earned money. This USED to be the best Filipino food in town and now, it is definitely the WORST. Will definitely NEVER eat their food again. Other food including their boneless milk fish was not good either so it's not just their kare kare. Would rather go to other point, point joints than to go to this "restaurant." Good luck if you do eat here.<//review>

< text>
Extremely expensive. I treated my friend from out-of-town and I was embarrassed. The fish we ordered  "inihaw na bangus" was stuffed with a lot of chopped tomato and something else tasted "gilik" and didnt taste  grilled at all. The rice was hard and looked like left-over, the fresh lumpia didnt taste good either.  Although after complaining to the server they replaced the "gilik" or lumot-taste-like milkfish with crispy pata that we took home. That was a good gesture.  We could have gone to other FIlipino fast food places for reasonable price instead. Chinese pa naman ang friend ko with  good food criteria and descriminating taste. What an experience.< /text>

(Translated by Google) Great Filipino food.
Ordering tip:
Tender crispy butter. Love the kare-kare. Try the chopsuey (veggies). Also love the alamang (or baguk in Kapampangan.) If you are craving real Pinoy food, Barrio Fiesta is great. (Remember to tip your server generously.) Good job. Manyaman !!! (Yummy in Kapampangan.) üòã

(Original)
Great Filipino food.
Ordering tip:
Tender crispy pata. Love the kare-kare. Try the chopsuey (veggies). Also love the alamang (or baguk in Kapampangan.) If you are craving real Pinoy food, Barrio Fiesta is great. (Remember to tip your server generously.) Sisig bangus. Manyaman!!! (Yummy in Kapampangan.) üòã</text>

This complaint is directed at Gordon Biersch restaurant located in San Jose, CA airport. I sat myself at the bar, a woman by the name of Reba, greeted other customets with a good morning and basically threw my menu down and walked away. I thought ok, maybe that was an oversight. She continued to completely ignore me, did not once return to ask if I needed something to drink or to take my order. A group of three people walked in, she immediately greeted them with a good morning, took their beverage orders, prepared their drinks and served them. I was not busy on my phone. I looked right at her with my arms crossed the entire time. She finally walks over to me after greetings yet another customer with good morning and says "did you want to order?". I replied no and asked for her name. This was not my first time there but it will definitely be my last. I was utterly disgusted by her behavior and lack of proper customer service. I'd hate to think it was racially inclined but one can't help but wonder. Reba does not need to be behind that counter with that sort of behavior. It is unacceptable. I travel quite often and this situation was disturbing. Again, the restaurant is in SAN JOSE AIPRORT, NOT SAN DIEGO CA</Text>

I ordered a western omlette; they brought watery spinach-mushroom soup, flavored with goat cheese and wrapped in chewy yellow paper. The guy in the kitchen seems to think that cutting potatoes and dipping them in hot oil is what is meant by "seasoning" them. They got one thing right - the sourdough toast was indeed sour. 0x808fcbc149f3ab9d:0x62d0d8100eeed189< /Gmap_id>
<Resp>None</Resp><time>1522359490865</time>< Text>
I travel a lot out of San Jose minimum twice a month and there are so few options to eat at. This is maybe my 6th time and trust me it doesn't get better, you just learn to deal with it. The food is sub par, you have to know what to order. The bartenders are ok. The waitresses eh about the same. Everything is just sort of ok. There is one waitress a Melinda I think, that is just awful. The first time she ignored me after she dropped a menu on the table. I've had her at least one other time and she never writes anything down and tends to not bring the right food. They are more concerned about dancing and singing to the music at the end of the bar with everyone else. It's like they are here for the party not the job. It's also always dirty. Looks like they never sweep the floors during the day or evening. Tables don't get wiped often, so clean your table yourself, you've been warned.

Like I said it gets worse but what's the point you can't really avoid this place since there's only maybe 5 other places to eat at in this terminal. And it's 1 of only 2 places to get a beer. So what are you gonna do. Maybe the owners will one day do something about all these bad reviews.</Text>

The waitstaff ignored me so i sat at the bar.   The bartender was attentive  and warned me about the coffee being not very good.  I ordered the "kobe" burger.   I know that there is no kobe standard in the us and the name is meaningless.  However, aside from the beef not being anything to write home about, the burger was cooked poorly. If that burger was acceptable, i wonder how bad the coffee had to have been?<//Text>

She asked to see the surveillance video, and he told her that he would have the manager look at it the next morning. She had to make countless phone calls to get them to look into it.  They finally returned her call, and admitted that she indeed paid $40.  They told her to come in the following day so that she could fill the remaining $20 of gas.  So, she had to return to this gas station again.  They never even apologized or offered her compensation in any way for their mistake< /review>< Rating>

< time>
1595653690821</time>
<Rate>5<//Rate>< Text>
Great casual Mexican place with excellent menu and fast friendly service. Chips and (medium-hot) salsa arrive as soon as you sit down. Everything is good here, above average tacos, enchiladas, burritos, and specialty plates.  My favorites are the Al Pastor plate and filete de pescado (fish) plate.  Rice and beans are excellent, dishes are served with garnishes and a small side salad. Beers and michiladas but no margs.
Been coming here for years, easy-going East Foothills vibe.< /Text>

<Date>1521758849321< /Date><rating>3<//rating><review>I ordered the Pastor Super Burrito for $8.50 and was disappointed that there was more fat than meat. Waitress doesn't speak English very well so a bit hard to communicate if you don't speak Spanish. She was friendly though and service was pretty good. Was not crowded on a Wed. evening at 8:00pm. Atmosphere is better than most "authentic" Mexican food restaurants. Nice murals on the wall. Maybe another meat is better but I don't recommend the Pastor meat. Disappointing since the name of the place includes Pastor. If you like lots of fat and gristle in your food, you might like it better than me.</review>< pictures>

<review>I've been going to Jesse for 3-4 years for my haircuts and hairstyling, and here's a few reasons why I keep coming back.

I like to change up my style every so often and Jesse is always down to help me with my vision. I don't always have a complete idea of what I'm after and Jesse helps to tie it all together into a cohesive look.

I appreciate that Jesse doesn't rush the haircuts and takes his time to get even the small details right. He'll obsess over the hairs behind the ears to make sure that even the areas most people wouldn't notice get the attention and treatment.

Jesse is an artist who I absolutely trust with my hair. I almost don't even want to write this review because it might mean more people will hire him and there will less time available for me when I need a cut. What I'm trying to say is, this dude is the best!< /review><pictures>None</pictures>< Resp>

< review>
I usually wait a few days after Jesse cuts my hair to let myself fully appreciate the cut he has given me and every time: EVERY TIME, I text him to tell him that the cut he has just given me has been the best haircut I have ever gotten. This is not an exaggeration. Jesse's cuts are great on so many levels.
I've been going to Jesse for my cuts for the past 9 years. Over that time I have consistently noticed how well his cuts grow out. They remain balanced and manageable for months if necessary. Once I was away from LA for 3 months and when I returned my hair still had shape and style. The extreme version of this has been over the past year when getting a haircut was not always an option. I opted to wait. And wait. And wait. A year went by before I called Jesse for a fresh cut. Honestly in that year it was only in the last month that my hair no longer felt balanced and manageable.
Jesse's latest cut has incorporated my newfound appreciation of longer hair while giving me a style I can live with, but more than that I felt that besides giving me an excellent cut, Jesse gave me a sense of self that had been lacking over the last year. What once seemed to be a simple and necessary task of getting a haircut took on a new kind of specialness in light of the lack of that opportunity over the last year. Jesse recognizes this and made sure I felt cared for and comfortable with the process.
I give Jesse my highest recommendation and urge anyone looking for a great style to call him and book an appointment.</review>

<Date>1616733535773< /Date><Rating>5</Rating><text>Jesse has been cutting my hair for seven years now, because he's the very best. At first I went to him only here and there, because i was broke and $100 felt like a lot for a haircut. But for what he does, its a steal. After I get my hair cut I feel incredible for two months at least (it grows out beautifully and I could go longer, but I like the short parts to stay short). Before I went to him I thought I had straight limp hair, but Jesse cut it to reveal my underlying curls which I didn't know i had but absolutely love. His specialty is 70s and 80s inspired cuts - I remember him remarking once that he could tell sid vicious's hair was cut with a razor just by looking at a picture. He'll talk your ear off about how Patti Smith cut her hair like Keith Richards who cut his own hair in the front - this guy really knows his stuff. <userid>108515701081730112670< /userid><name>Francisco Leung<//name><Time>1509177582105<//Time>< rate>
5</rate>
< Review>
We primarily come for the playground area for my kids. There is a decent sized sandbox to play in that will fit many kids. There are 2 main playgrounds for different age levels that are separated by fences which is really nice. Typical swing sets that are on all playgrounds.

The really cool part is that the playground is next to a school that has several basketball hoops and lots of open space for play with lines pre-drawn on the pavement. When school is over, the school's marked pavement is like an extension of the playground for other games.<//Review>

< text>
Phenomenal time! I am not a beginner surfer and was looking to fine tune some skills and learn some new ones. I also ended up getting the photo package. The whole session was worth every penny. Good photos and I did pick up a few good pointers to improve my surf. You could tell sharing the stoke with the beginner surfers and the experienced surfers was all Marty's passion. Marjan took some great photographs and the communication with the team throughout booking and experience was great. I was only in town for one day, but will definitely be back. andrea leonard< /name>
<Pics>None<//Pics>< Review>
I booked a private 90 minute lesson for my husband who wanted to get back into surfing.  I had to rearrange a couple of times due to work commitments and the process was super easy.  On the day the whole team were friendly and laid back but professional.  My husband really enjoyed the lesson and as we are new to Los Angeles it was a great way for him to find out local information about the best spots to surf and to dust off the cobwebs.  He picked up some good technique tips and is feeling sore today, in a good way! Would highly recommend for beginners as well as intermediates wanting to get back into surfing<//Review>

<user>104659725020869635267< /user><Time>1617063158595<//Time><Rating>5</Rating></record></dataset><record>
<userid>115614418693018712484<//userid><username>DJ Davids<//username>< time>
1596906479087</time>
<Rate>5< /Rate>< text>
I've taken surf lessons in multiple cities from multiple groups and Kapowui was by far the best.

We went over all the foundations from what part of the surfboard is what, and how to stand on it/turn to mastering each part of the pop up before getting into the water. Then, when we did, surfing was much easier for me than ever and it felt like second nature.

The staff is also so friendly that even people on the beach who weren't taking a lesson with them and asked them questions got answers and they couldn't have been happier to help.

Would never take another lesson anywhere else. It was fun, I learned a lot, and feel way more comfortable on a surf board. Don't forget to add their photographer to your lesson - she takes amazing pics! A++<//text>

<Text>My son had been wanting to do surfing lessons for quite some time and we were finally able to fly out of Houston and head to California for him to enjoy some beach time. Todd and Claudio were great instructors and really took the time to make sure my son, who is only 9, felt comfortable with the movements and made sure that it was a good birthday experience for him. Even when my son got frustrated trying to get the movements down in the sand, they continued to work with him until he got it right. His first time riding the waves, he stood up on his surfboard and rode it all the way to the shore! Their energy and positivity was great and you can tell that with all of the employees, helping people have the best surfing experience possible really is their passion. The only part I was bummed about was the purchase of the GOPRO. Once we received the SD cards, the files were corrupted, BUT when I brought this to the owners attention he immediately offered a number of solutions and gave me a refund for the hassle. The next time I am in California I am definitely going to book with them again!< /Text>< Response>

< review>
I've taken 3 lessons with Kapowui so far (once with Liam and twice with Todd) and my surfing experience has been super awesome every time. The instructors have a lot of knowledge to share about the waves and how to surf. I had a great time in the water with them and they give feedback on every attempted wave which really helped to remind me what to focus on. I asked tons of questions to help me visualize and understand the wave science and they had answers for all of them which was super helpful. I would definitely recommend Kapowui over other schools that were just kinda "meh" in my opinion.</review>

<userid>109320270397558476000< /userid><username>Jennifer Schindler<//username><time>1606677615086< /time>< Text>
My kids (12 and 15) and their cousins (13 and 16) took a two hour lesson from Conner and Todd.  Three of the teens were still beginners, having had only a couple lessons in the past.  They spent 30-40 minutes getting gear and then walking through the surf steps on the beach before getting in the water.  They had a blast - all managed to ride some waves, being pushed into wave by the instructor.  Were having so much fun they asked to stay for an extra hour (which we did).  More experienced teen rode waves with Conner for a couple hours and got good tips on how to improve and read the break.  Great communication with Martin (on site leader) and Marjan (phone & email ahead of time).  Easy location to find, tons of gear to use.  In fact, kids were able to try different boards, to see which ones were easier based on their size and balance.  Would highly recommend!  Maholo!</Text>

< Text>
Kapowui are extremely professional and I can't recommend them highly enough. I signed up for an individual 1.5 hour lesson and indicated that I was open to having more people added to my group. Another student was added who paid for 2 hours, so the instructors let me have an extra half hour for the price of 1.5. I was also lucky to have two instructors (Mark and Luke, who were both clearly qualified and enthusiastic surfers and teachers). There was a lot of focus on appropriate technique during the land and water portions of the lesson. Even after successfully catching multiple waves, I received a lots of feedback on how to improve my stance and control. After the lesson, I was able to purchase my (used) wetsuit for a really affordable price. I'll definitely be a regular!<//Text>

I found this place as I was skating by the other day, I took a picture and didn't think much of it. However today was my brother's birthday and couldn't think of a better place to take him but here.

This was the BEST experience of our Los Angeles visit by a landslide! We chose Will as our instructor and he was so chill & a great teacher. Very patient and great at helping us learn safely. We both actually managed to stand up on and ride some waves - and it was our first time ever surfing! <Response>None<//Response><review>I had a great experience learning how to surf with Madeline at Kapowui Surf Lessons. I had never surfed before so I was a little nervous going into it but by the end I was hooked and can‚Äôt wait to try it again. We started with a lesson on the sand to learn the four steps to getting into the surf position. We repeated it a number of times and received feedback from Madeline about how to improve. She made sure the three of us in the lesson had a good understanding and were able to perform the moves before we went into the water. In the water she would help us catch the wave and indicate when we needed to stand up. This was helpful so we could focus on applying the techniques that we learned on the sand. Again Madeline provided feedback after each time and was very easy going making it a more enjoyable experience. We had a blast and I look forward to the next lesson.< /review><time>1582939316550< /time>< user>

< user>
104443030967167119126</user>
< Name>
Abhigna Mandavilli< /Name>
<date>1581283824505</date><Rate>5<//Rate>< text>
TL;DR: Kapowui is the real deal! Ultimate value for money, personalized instructions, surfing at a no-crowd part of the beach, and detailed feedback at every step, resulting in quick progress and a great experience.

The Details:

A little bit of background before I go into the details of my experience with Kapowui. As of the date of posting this review, I had been surfing for 3-4 months but was never able to fully ride a green wave (face of an unbroken wave). I had taken a couple of lessons at another surfing school, but my experience was far from satisfactory. Neither did I get the private lessons I had been promised, nor did I get detailed feedback. I decided to try out Kapowui after looking at reviews, and I wish I had started out with Kapowui in the first place.

Martin, the owner, was extremely friendly and asked me to try out a class first and then decide if I wanted to sign up for a package deal. My first class was with Gregory (Greg) aka G-Force. He is a highly experienced surfer  and an exceptional instructor (15+ years experience teaching). He corrected some bad practices I had picked up, and had me surfing green waves within 30 minutes!

After that experience, I decided to sign up for 5 classes at once, and took another class with Greg. I felt like I had taken some big strides in terms of my surfing ability, and was able to catch green waves more consistently.

Another big plus is that Kapowui is located near a beach that is near-secluded in the off-season, so you don't have to worry about being hit by oncoming surfers. It's a lot more relaxing when you focus on the surfing part, which is difficult as it is.

If you are looking for that one-off experience as a tourist, or looking to crank your skills up a notch, Kapowui is the place you want to be.<//text>

< gmapID>
0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//gmapID>
< Review>
Very professional approach.  Great website. They park their cool 60s Volkswagon van at the parking entrance as a nice visual intro (can't miss them).  They supply the boards and wetsuits, a discount for multiple people, but most importantly excellent instruction.  Blake taught my two daughters land drills for the prone position, a lunge move to get upright, and balance tips.  He offered great descriptive and prescriptive feedback when either daughter needed adjustments and encouragement.  This takes about 1/2 hour, so I suggest signing up for the 1.5 hour session to give you a full hour in the water.  He promised both girls would succeed in getting up and riding some waves.  He was right. One daughter caught on and had multiple successes.  He continued working hard with the other daughter until she got up and rode a solid wave all the way in. Blake showed patience throughout with a pleasant demeanor and comforting approach. I would suggest him, but I am sure Martin would only hire excellent instructors so you will do well with whoever instructs you.  Thanks Blake and Martin.
Jeff B.</Review>

<Name>Trey Lohman< /Name>< Date>
1566840872287<//Date>
<Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
Very good place to get a lesson! They have a cool team working there and are very helpful with any questions, surf or non-surf related. I started with little surfing experience. Ive wake surfed before but this was a lot different. I was able to get up on the board and ride a few waves into shore by the end of the lesson. That was the same for the other two individual that took the class, except neither of them had any type of surf experience. They are affordable and actually offer cheaper options if you do a group lessons. The Kapowui team definitely set me up for surfing success! ü§ôüèªLastly, I want to mention that i was able to take my skills gained from this experience and rent a board in Santa Cruz, WITHOUT the need of another lesson, and had loads of fun!</Review>

<Text>Tood showed us how to shred the gnar today during our surfing lessoning. Definitely worth our morning. Check them out ü§ôüèº< /Text>< Pics>

<Response>None< /Response><GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//GmapID></record></dataset><record>
<Text>Surfing class at Kapowui is the perfect mix between our Beach-Boys based, bleached-blonde fantasy of California surfing and the actual, real, raw athletic effort that any sport requires.
In my first class with lovely Haylee we began with learning on the sand the basic four technical steps that take any surfer (including Patrick Swayze in Point Break) from flat belly down on the board to up on your feet riding the hurricane of your life.
But no, once in the water, I rode no hurricanes and I definitely did not look‚Äîneither feel‚Äîlike the female version of Swayze. Well, the pink-shaded waves of this sunny yet impalpable California dawn did feel like hurricanes to my inexperience, though, especially each time I fell off the board even before hitting step four, the one that actually places your feet on the board, your upper body all the way up and your eyes into your freedom (the moment when the fun is supposed to begin, basically).
One time (maybe three, but two of them count only as a rehearsal), with the assistance and the direction of Haylee, for a few seconds that felt like a serendipitous eternity, I was actually able to catch, feel and maintain my balance and ride my personal Friday morning's hurricane (probably the most peaceful wave ever in the history of the entire Pacific Ocean). And, that really felt like an accomplishment! Another accomplishment was when I started understanding what I was doing wrong, like when I was leaning too much forward (and therefore falling into the water even before standing up on the board) or when I was trying to get up and catch the wave too soon or too late (and, by doing that, I was completely missing the momentum and the physical and spiritual connection with the wave).
But, above all, it's the intimacy with the ocean, that I enjoyed the most. Since I took a semi-private class, while Haylee was working with the other student, I had long moments on my own. As I had just been taught to always place my board's nose (yeah, that's how they call it) toward the horizon (Haylee was pretty clear about the surfer's etiquette in the water!), I could breath in the mysterious dissolution of that blue far end-line while receiving the gift of the most magical dance choreographed by a family of silver fishes (I swear I never saw one single fish in the ocean, before) and admiring the million dollar flight of the immeasurably powerful yet gracefully humble seagulls.
Indeed a blessed experience, this first surf lesson, thanks to the professionalism of the Kapowui's team and my teacher Haylee's training tips and health-safety supervision.
Heading back home to get the sand off my feet, now. Listening to a Beach Boys' song, of course!<//Text><Time>1597438069963</Time><UserId.>100121273631712031857<//UserId.><Name>Liliana Isella< /Name>< rating>
5< /rating>
<Pics>None< /Pics><Response>None<//Response>< GmapID>
0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9< /GmapID>
</record></dataset><record>

< review>
I highly recommend Kapowui to anyone who wants to take surf lessons in the LA area.
I live in LA and have tried a few other surf lesson providers in the area.  I've also gone surfing a few times with local guides on tropical vacations.  The quality of instruction and positive vibes at Kapowui far exceeds the local competition.  I find myself enjoying the lessons with Kapowui at Venice just as much as I have enjoyed my surf sessions in the tropics (and they don't have the help of 80 degree water and gently peeling reef breaks).
So far I have taken 15+ lessons with Kapowui.  I can feel progress after each session.  All of the instructors give sound advice and quality tips while also maintaining a fun atmosphere.  Recently I've had more sessions with Carl, and he's really helped me improve a lot.  I also recommend Todd and Ryan.
In summary, go surfing with Kapowui! It'll be fun!< /review>

< Text>
Kapowui surf school is the best! I have never gone surfing before and I couldn‚Äôt have picked a better company to learn from! While scheduling our lesson online my friend mentioned we were absolute beginners and we got matched up for a lesson with Harry. First, Harry made sure we were all comfortable during the land portion. He expertly explained the different components of the board and gave us a quick class on ocean conditions. Next during the practical portion he encouraged us and gave us feedback on our form after every wave we rode. I felt safe having him as a teacher and under his instruction my friends and I all managed to get up on board by ourselves! It was a truly incredible experience and I now feel like I have the knowledge to go out and try surfing by myself. I will definitely be renting my equipment from the Kapowui school in the future! Highly recommend this place!<//Text>

Had an excellent 2-person lesson with Carl then came back a second day to rent equipment and practice more.  Carl, who is a competitive surfer, taught the fundamentals beach side then assisted in the surf.  Thanks to his help and instruction I was able to stand multiple times and ride some waves from break to beach.  It was a fun and exhilarating experience.   Don't expect to hang ten the first time out but what a fun sport to take on.  Surfing is like life, you try, you fall down, you succeed now and then, and you keep climbing back on for more.   Thanks Kapowui and Carl for a memorable time!!   Highly recommended.< /text>

Reuben was an awesome instructor! Ive been surfing for 8 years summer months in NY for most of my life. He asked first what my skill level was, checked my pop up stance and proceeded to throw me in water to guage what I needed work on. He was super insightful, knowledgeable and awesome on the board(he almost got pitted). He would show me his style and thought process on how he would catch a wave. I highly recommend him to anyone who's planning to try this school out that is at any skill level. You wont go wrong!< /review>

< Review>
I had a 1.5 hour 8 AM lesson with Ed. He was great! We covered the various parts of a surfboard and their purpose, why exactly we were going to be surfing where we were, how to get to the surfer pose, and the safety aspects of surfing. All of this was one-on-one and done at a pace that covered everything thoroughly and left plenty of time in the water.

I felt that Ed is genuinely happy to see his students do well. He celebrated along with me when I rode my first wave! I can't recommend Kapowui highly enough!<//Review>

< Text>
Kapowui surf school is super welcoming, friendly, and helpful. There's been detailed instructions before the class and plenty of reminders to help me not forget to set an alarm lol. When we got to the beach, their van is really easy to find.
Our instructor Colston was very knowledeable, and provides really helpful and detailed instructions. In order to help us catch a wave, he kept moving along the beach to find nice and easy waves, and also exchanged some bigger surf boards so it was easier to maintain balance. Eventually my friend and I both caught a wave by the end of the lesson! It was really fun and we're definitely down to surf again.</Text>

{'time': 1535918542060, 'text': "Sonya, as to your 1st issue, about there being to many people in the water, we are allowed  by the city to do our lessons in a specific permitted Zone so we and there are many sand bars, rips, swimmers,  and other hazards the instructor has to take into account to insure your are in the safest and best area. Issue 2, barking instructor,  each instructor has his own teaching style. Issue 3, lesson finishing and you not thinking it was personable,  we book our lessons back to back especially in the summer on a Saturday , so the instructors can maximize their income for the year since this is a seasonal job and they have 5 months to make their money for the year. I'm not sure what you expected your instructor to do after the lesson was over. Each instructor has multiple jobs requirements other than just doing lessons, so getting water is necessary so we can clean wet suits between lessons. We have had multiple instructors quit recently due to burn out and I should have been at the beach to help out but I had my own issues. Issue 4,  you not getting the instructor you booked online, Lulu quit so there was no way for you to get her, and as it clearly states on my website you are not guaranteed the instructor you book online. Sounds like the instructors did everything they were suppose to do.  I'm sorry we didn't meet your expectations. It's reviews like this that really bum me out."}< /Resp>
<name>Sonya M Shafer< /name>< pics>

107099240566199158785< /user_id>
<rating>4<//rating>< Text>
Overall, the instructor was attentive and clear. This was a private lesson for 2 people who had never surfed before for 2 hours. We went early enough that we weren't really competing for space in the water, which made the first half of the experience good. In the second hour another instructor with 4 or 5 people joined us and it felt a bit crowded. The other instructor was barking out orders at his group, drill sergeant style. The experience felt authentic, though when we returned to the van, the instructor was rushed into his next lesson, which didn't feel personable at all. He was told to get some water and we hand shook and were sent off. He was good and knew how to act/what to say when the waves were rough to keep us calm. When I booked the lesson, I took the time to review each instructor, and chose the specific one I wanted, on purpose. I chose Lulu and wanted to surf with her, but when we got there, it was somebody else, without warning. He was good, though not what I paid the $220 for. If you go, go early, and don't bet 100% that you will get the instructor you've chosen, if you took the time to do your research.</Text>

<username>Justin O'Connell</username>< UserId.>
116482769100209162771< /UserId.>
< text>
Booked a 2 hour surf lesson with Travis on Friday the 3rd of May. Never been surfing before so I was a little bit nervous but needn't have been.
The guys could not have been more welcoming and my instructor Travis could not have been more helpful and engaged.
The surf lesson started off with a pod of dolphins swimming close off shore and just got better from there.
Travis had me standing up on my first wave on my second attempt and I had just an awesome time for the next 2 hours.
My only regret was I left this lesson till the last day of my holiday. If I had a few more days I would have been back.
Would recommend Kapowui to anyone looking to learn how to surf and get some of that Californian surfing spirit.<//text>

<Rating>5</Rating>< Review>
Kapowui is an excellent place to learn how to surf. The instructors are incredibly positive and willing to share their passion for surfing with you, which makes for a great experience. They are also great at explaining and helping you to focus on the fundamentals that will help you to catch awesome waves, and do an amazing job of making you feel safe in the water, even if the surf is rough.

Shout out to Todd for being an awesome instructor. I enjoyed my lesson so much that I immediately scheduled a follow-up. I can't wait to learn more about surfing with Kapowui!</Review>

< review>
Incredible experience with The Kapowui gang!! Had a 90min lesson with Travis who improved my knowledge and helped improve my skill set so much!! Had a group session booked for the next day but since it was all beginners they called up Clay and he showed up (even tho he had the morning off to sleep in!) and he came to do a private lesson with me so we could work going down the line. Clay and Travis were both very kind and knowledgeable. Martin, the owner made sure my quick weekend trip was full of waves, fun and a super chill staff to hang with. Super easy to find the adorable vans in front of the beach and they set you all up. All the staff asked numerous times if I had any additional questions or anything else I wanted to try. Extremely helpful and I learned SO much! Uber will drop you off right in front of the vans, like a 50ft walk. I‚Äôll be going back any time I‚Äôm in Venice for sure! Can‚Äôt say enough great things about the Kapowui crew! Go catch some waves!<//review>

< username>
Kevin Moran<//username>
< Review>
Kapowui was one of the best experiences I've had with a business, everyone I spoke to made me feel welcome. Took my first ever surf lesson with Ruben, and could not recommend him enough. Would also recommend the GoPro package.

I took the 2 hour lesson, which felt like a perfect length. I thought I might spend quite a bit of time on the beach going over the basics, but Ruben got me in the water and on waves super quickly.

Every time I fell, he'd point out one thing to try and focus on for the next run, and it would make such a difference each time. We would tackle simpler waves to nail down the new points, and every now and again he'd throw me more of a challenge, which usually resulted in me falling over but that's how you learn. By the end of the session, was standing up the whole way to the sand, even if i was a little wobbly. I've always wanted to try surfing, and could not stop smiling all morning.

It's very clear Martin (the owner) takes great care in choosing all his instructors, you'll have a fantastic experience with any of them.</Review>

< rate>

<Review>I signed myself and two of my good friends up for a group surfing lesson (Kapowui does group lessons at discounted rates!) and I am so glad I chose them. First of all, they have the coolest surfer van with rentable surfboards and wetsuits of varying sizes for everyone, and the parking was not difficult nor expensive at the time that we went (early morning on Sunday).

I was the only true beginner at the lesson, my two girlfriends had surfed before in the past, but both of them said afterwards that the instruction was very enlightening and made it that much better and easier to surf with success; they learned a lot. All three of us were standing on our boards and able to surf toward the shore on some whitewashes in no time :) Todd was our awesome teacher and he spent the first 30 minutes of our 2 hour session just explaining basic physics of the board and ideal positioning and technique to get up on the board, and then the full 1.5 remaining hours we were just in the water. I really appreciated his sincere and supportive attitude as a teacher! We also met Martin and his chill Cavalier King Charles Spaniel and both he and Todd just had the best vibes. Good people.

If you want to learn to surf I couldn‚Äôt give you a stronger recommendation to go with them! They are the best and I am so inspired to keep at it :) thank you Kapowui üôèüèª<//Review>< Pics>

< review>
What an awesome Experience! I signed up with Leon for myself and my two girls age 14 and 9  to try out surfing for the very first time. With not much expectation and nerves setting in , Leon managed to keep us calm and motivated for the lesson. We then did a very helpful 30 min beach lesson about the correct techniques of surfing and once we had that down we were out in the water and within the first few waves we were all up and surfing.

This was an experience that we will never forget with a very big thanks to Kapowui and Leon for being so kind and enthusiastic throughout the lesson.

We will surely be back next year!<//review>

< text>
Great company, great experience!
My first time learning to surf was a great experience. The folks at Kapowui are well organized, great with communication, and very professional. I booked with them, showed up at the correct time, and they took care of  all the rest.
My instructor was Juan. I was riding waves after my 3rd try, thanks to his help. I had a ton of fun, and took home memories that i will treasure forever.
If you're looking to surf in LA, look no farther. You've found it!

Rick P</text>

1582000021879</Date>
<rate>5</rate>< Review>
Kapowui instructor Colston was an energetic competent instructor who managed to get our 15 yr.old son up on the waves surfing in no time.
We just walked up and asked if he could teach our son to surf and he had no other booked lessons at the time and was eager and willing to help us out. Our son had a private lesson for 1.5 hours with Colston and is was very affordable (cheaper than Disneyland).
Colston was easy to chat with and knowledgeable about surfing. Our son had a great time and is wanting to surf more. Unfortunately, we are from Alberta, Canada so his surfing dreams will have to wait until we come back again.
Thanks Colston and Kapowui Surfing for a great afternoon at the beach riding the waves!</Review>

<user_name>Tammy H</user_name>< Review>
We had the 9am Group surf lesson on a Sunday. I expected a full parking lot but it wasnt packed at all. Plenty of room to park in the morning but it does get more crowded later on in the day. Our instructor Todd was an awesome person very knowledgable and big on safety. If your looking for surf lessons no matter what experience you are these guys are the ones!<//Review>

<rating>5< /rating><username>Maija Andrijauska</username>< text>
I had a two hours surfing lesson with Leon - a very attentive, smart and talented instructor. In the first 20 minutes he thoroughly and patiently explained me the theory of surfing, and then he was a supportive teacher who helped me to catch big waves of Venice Beach.  With him beside me, I had no fear of diving under the more than 1,5 m high waves. Having never surfed before, just after one lesson I know how to stand on the board, how to catch the wave, and I surely would repeat this great experience and would like to make surfing my hobby. Would highly recommend Kapowui and Leon as an instructor.<//text>

< Text>
The instructor with the blonde hair and blue eyes who told us from she was from another country. Compared me to another on the group lesson saying I wasn't as flexible as my counterpart and later yelled at me the whole entire lesson in the water stating I'm not doing what I'm supposed to do so it made it more mentally challenging while I observed the other instructors not yelling at their customers wishing to be in their group.  I was disappointed because this was the one activity in Santa Monica, California I was looking forward to doing....learning to surf.</Text>

< resp>
{'time': 1564574871639, 'text': "Hi Venessa, this is Martin the owner of kapowui. I'm very sorry and disappointed that you left feeling this way. I really wish you would have talked to me before you left and then I could have addressed your issues in person. Your instructor, Nofar thought you loved your lessons, because you seemed so happy and stood up so much, she was actually shocked that you left with out leaving a tip that's how certain she was  you had a great time.  I've talked to Nofar and found out what happened. As far as comparing you to the other person in your lessons, it was not to make you feel uncomfortable it was just stating facts and  explaining to you why you were learning a different techinque than the other guy in your lesson. Because you were less flexible than the guy so she had to personalize your pop up technique to accommodate your inflexibility and body type. She did this so you would have a chance of standing up, and it worked, you stood up multiple times. Just to let you know there are many ways to teach a the pop up, one way does not work for all people, so we match the technique to the individual, otherwise only 50% of our lessons would stand up compared to 100%.  As far as yelling at you in the lesson, Nofar would never do that in a mean way. What you have to realize is she's trying to give you feedback on every wave so you can progress and learn as much as possible in the short time we have with you. So every time she pushes you in a wave she watches you till you fall so she can give you feed back on what you did wrong and she needs to do this immediately before she forgets what and this must be done over cacophony of crashing and breaking waves. So you are right she was yelling, but only so you could hear her, not because was mad, frustrated, or disappointed in you. I hope this helps you understand more about what transpired during your lesson and ease any disappointment you have felt. Perhaps now with this new knowledge and understand you can look back with fond memories of your lesson. I'm not going to ask you to change your review but now that you have a better understanding of what happened I hope you reconsider your review score. Lastly I'm really bummed out you left feeling this way, if you are ever back in town stop by and I'll talk to you in person and we'll see what we can do to make your next lesson live up to your expectations. Sincerely Martin."}< /resp>

</record></dataset><record>
<Review>Words cannot begin to describe how cool and memorable my experience with Kapowui has been! If you are looking for a genuinely fun and potentially life changing experience in Southern California, this is your place!

I live in the middle of Europe, with the closest beach an 8 hour drive from my home, so surfing ocean waves is a HUGE step out of the comfort zone for me. Despite having no experience whatsoever with any board sports, no knowledge of waves or anything remotely related to surfing, my instructor, Will had me catching several cool waves and riding them all the way to the beach within about 40 minutes of arriving at the beach!

We started with a beach lesson where I was shown what to do, proper technique, and given safety advice, and then we headed into the water. After a couple of falls, I started catching waves really fast. The instructor stands with you in the water and helps catch your first waves, gives pointers on what to do different next time to improve, so it is a quick learning curve and very very gratifying. Having had zero previous experience, it was an unbelievably cool feeling to be able to stand up and ride a wave so quickly.

I was hooked instantly, so actually went back for a second lesson during my short stay in LA. I really recommend you do that too, as the second time your body already has some memory of this new activity and the experience is even more gratifying! I was catching waves with more confidence the second time!

All the guys I met at Kapowui, Will, my awesome instructor, Martin, the owner, and the other instructors too, everyone was super friendly and nice. They are also very flexible with scheduling your lesson, and actually recommend the best time on that particular day, checking tides, etc.

Anytime I am in LA in the future, I will be there at the beach catching waves with these guys! You got a new lifetime customer, and what is even cooler, a new fan of surfing! <3

One more note about why I wrote ‚Äúpotentially life-changing experience‚Äù above. It truly has been that for me. Surfing for the first time last week with Will turned out to be a huge lesson on my own fitness level (actually, lack thereof), my ability to face setbacks and my fears (getting washed out by a huge wave is terrifying at first‚Ä¶ and then you cope with it‚Ä¶because you have to - how many times do you get to practice that within a one-hour timeframe?). These two sessions with Kapowui have actually opened up my mind and heart to several new goals to work toward in life‚Ä¶ an unexpected, but very welcome bonus not mentioned on Kapowui‚Äôs website. :)

Thank you soooo much guys, I will be back! :)

P.S.: one more thing‚Ä¶ a day after my lesson I sat at the beach looking at a bunch of guys trying surfing for the first time, being instructed by someone obviously not trained to do so (probably a friend or volunteer). They caught exactly zero waves in the one hour or so, and left tired but frustrated by the experience. As I mentioned, I have zero knowledge of surfing, yet even I could tell from a distance that they were sitting at the wrong spot in the water, and not shown properly what to do and when. They should have saved themselves the frustration and get a lesson with Kapowui instead! :)

See you Kapowui, very soon! <3< /Review>< Name>
Katalin Torok<//Name>

<Review>I had an awesome experience with my private lesson with Kapowui. I didn't pick a particular instructor and trusted them to pair me with the best one based on my experience for my lesson. I worked with Leon for 2 hours and it was amazing, we joked that we should just book another 4 to keep going! As I had surfed before and was moving onto green waves (unbroken) I was super stoked to have a 1:1 and conquer the next phase. Leon's instructions were clear and his coaching was very encouraging. We did a lot of laughing, hanging, and catching waves and it was exactly what I needed. I was definitely bummed to see the 2hours end. He's among my top 2 surf instructors/experiences to date. <Text>We wanted to do something special for my grandsons when they visited from the Atlanta area. We thought they would really enjoy the surfing experience so I searched the internet and kept coming up with great reviews on Kapoui. I started corresponding with Martin, the owner, to build the best experience for the boys. He set us up with Todd for morning and afternoon lessons. The entire process and lessons went great. Todd was the perfect instructor for them. He was friendly, outgoing, patient and gave them a  surfing experience that they will always remember. Both boys was thrilled and talked about it all night.  Martin ensured that everything exactly as planned.

I would highly recommend Kapowui to anyone looking for that first time surfing experience. And if you are in the LA area and what to give you child or grandchild a memorable experience surfing with Kapoui is the place to go. I have to say that Todd was an outstanding instructor and we would use him again durning the boy's next visit.  However, while there I had to opportunity to see the other instructors in action and they all were extremely qualified.<//Text></record>

< Review>
I had a group of 10 and Martin was able to accommodate us all on short notice for an early morning (630am) lesson before work - it was great!  We were a mix of surfers - from absolutely no experience to having surfed a handful of times -and the format fit our needs perfectly. You get the full experience and if you lucky enough get to see the dolphins swim by at the same time! I recommend Kapowui from start to finish. <GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9</GmapID>< time>
1458200185986< /time>
<user_name>Matthew Beirouti</user_name><UserId.>110429013041203001067< /UserId.>< text>
One of the best decisions I made while visiting Venice Beach. Awesome name with awesome people. Marty and Kenny were both friendly and helpful! I wanted to learn how to surf for the first time and was kind of hesitant to go with an instructor from one of the other equipment rental shops. While walking along the front walk, my eye caught this beautiful orange van in a parking lot, stacked with colored boards.

I met Marty who explained to us that since the weather was suboptimal that morning, he would be robbing us of money if he gave us a lesson. Instead he proposed a day and time when he knew the ocean would be more forgiving and offered to take us then. I really appreciated Marty's integrity. I set up two lessons with Kenny, one of Marty's instructors whom I had the pleasure of meeting.  He was very friendly and gave us valuable instruction and trooped through some pretty rough waves to teach my buddy and I. This guy is top notch. My buddy caught waves on the first day and I caught quite a few more on the next, when the waters were a little lighter. Kapowui had great equipment, and Marty let us use his GoPro to take some awesome videos!

My trip to Venice Beach was made amazing thanks to Marty and Kenny. I highly recommend Kapowui!<//text>

Martin is the absolute best, along with every one of the instructors working at Kapowui, and I have surfed with pretty much everyone!  They are SO passionate about surfing, and care very much about equipping you with the skills and training that you need to excel at the sport.  They will always be honest with you about the conditions, and whether or not they work well with your skill level.  Not to mention, everyone that works here has encyclopedic knowledge about surfing.

I cannot thank Martin and everyone at Kapowui enough for all the time they have spent with me, both in the water, but also answering all of my surf related questions, and generally just being supportive of me as a surfer newbie.

I also want to say that I have taken lessons at other surf schools in the area, and no one has held a candle to the level of passion and commitment and thoroughness that I have seen at Kapowui. < user>
103146522616063177437< /user>
<Date>1541271873836</Date><Name>Dana McCormack</Name>< Gmap_id>
0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9< /Gmap_id>
< response>
None< /response>
< Pics>
None<//Pics>
< rate>
5<//rate>
< Text>
First time surfers, had a blast!  We were lucky enough to get Jeremie as an instructor, he was friendly, experienced, chill and has great teaching technique.  I really appreciated his no-nonsense instruction:  we were out on the water quicker than I anticipated and our 2-hour (2-people) lesson was non-stop fun!!  I didn't think I would get up in the first hour, but was standing up on my second wave!  The instruction and lesson  felt safe, which added to confidence and thus made for a great time with no stress.   I know that people may hesitate on the price (all the surf schools are about the same cost, btw) but when you think a night out with a bottle of wine and a really nice meal costs about the same.  This was a great deal more fun and we will certainly remember it much longer than a meal out, so dollars well spent!  We felt so good afterwards and spent the rest of the afternoon walking around Venice and back to the Pier.  I would recommend Kapowui for a spectacular experience to anyone.  Travel tip:  take the Expo Train out to Santa Monica and walk down Ocean Front.  It wasn't much longer than driving from downtown LA (45 minutes) and saves $$ for parking as well as the environment :)<//Text>
</record>
</dataset><record>

< user_id>
106295274415801189156</user_id>
<user_name>Hedi B.<//user_name>< review>
More times than I'd like to admit, I've received service from people with a ton of personality, only to realize they became too comfortable, taking liberties with the way they treated my business. Ex: The tailor you hit it off with, but starts delaying your alterations because he confused your kindness with his cousin's.

It's a shame when you find people with genuine personalities that fail at what you came to see them for.

Jeremie and Martin at Kapowui are able to balance professionalism and great personalities.

If you want to learn how to surf and feel like writing a five star review after you're done, this is the place.</review>
< date>
1474847447522< /date>
< pictures>
None<//pictures>

We all love your "damn the torpedoes" approach to surfing, it\'s the same way we do it. See you again one day I\'m sure, Martin'}<//response>< Review>
Really, truly simply, the best possible lesson I could have imagined. They not only effortlessly teach you the technicals, they convey in every possible way what one must do physically and mentally and dare I say spiritually to get up on a wave. And get up you definitely will. They teach you to let go and let it happen and that is 80% of the battle. Brilliant experience.</Review>

All the information you wanted ( prices, location, surf conditions, etc.) could be found on my website with a modicum of effort. So you assume since it's Sunday and you are not busy or working that no one else is or that your wants must be accommodated, wrong. And as I stated before I was super busy and  i didn't have time to ask the 10 questions it would have taken to get the answers from you  that I would have needed to steer you in the right direction. And I've found after 14 years in business 99.9% of the people over estimate there ability, so it's usually a waste of time to ask the questions in the 1st place. And exactly why did you come to my surf school wanting to give me your business, if I was that rude to you over the phone? There are literally a 100 other places to rent from. That's because our primary business is surf lessons not rentals, and this is the Fall/ October, so we don't stay at the beach all day like we do during the summer.  Had you asked over the phone I would have told you we were closing early to save you the trip or had you asked  I could have referred you to another place that specializes in rentals. We are not a corporate franchise that has set hours, we are a family business that is open when we have lessons or enough rentals to cover our overhead. Your request for a 4 hour rental would cost me money to stay open due to my overhead. The hours on my google maps are subject to change daily and is determined by our surf lesson schedule. The 6am-6pm is our availability for calls, not rentals or lessons. However, there is no way to delineate this on google maps. So now you know. < user>
106133816955926708649< /user>
<username>Ira & Yolanda Murphy</username><Date>1492357461744<//Date>< Rating>
5</Rating>
< text>
They say you find a way to make a living doing what you love. If this is not a manifestation of that very ideal, I don't know what is. I genuinely forgot that any part of this experience was a business transaction (we literally could recall if we had paid by the end of the session). My husband and my son were first time surfers and the team really cared about that. Their demonstrated awareness of conditions, assertiveness of their clients and overall enthusiasm has made us lifelong members.

Learning to surf with Mike was like sharing life experience with a cousin you had not seen since childhood. The entire staff made us feel like family. I don't think that I could put a fair price on the experience that Mike and the rest of the Kapowui staff gave us as first time surfers. I may even venture to say that we made new friends. There is a valid reason for this company to have achieved five stars across the board...it is a rarity.

Mike, thanks for going the extra mile to warm our little munchkin up to the water. You are an awesome person, instructor and surfer...

#OutOfManyOnePeople #TheMurphys</text>
< pics>
None<//pics>
< resp>
{'time': 1492425107921, 'text': "Yolanda, this is Martin the owner of Kapowui. I can not thank you enough for taking the time to write such an amazing review. You have a gift for writing. And I can not tell you how touched we all were by your words. Our goal is to make everyone feel like family and friends and I'm so happy we pulled through with you. And yes you did make new friends. Your husband and son were truly some of the best people I have ever met, you are a very lucky woman. I loved you husband and sons zest for life and their smiles were infectious. YOU are what gives me hope for the future and YOU are what keeps us going and makes all of our lives so full and blessed. Thank you from the deepest recesses of all our hearts. Please come back any time to hang out with your surfer family, you will always be welcome with open arms. Until we meet again, or if we never meet again have a blessed life, your new family and friends at Kapowui. Martin and the crew."}< /resp>

< text>
5 stars, hands down! I've lived in LA for 10+ years and never learned to surf because I was afraid of the water and didn't know what I was doing. Kapowui surf school came through!! Martin was super accommodating to my friend and I. We booked at the last minute and added my friend on the same day. Communication around the lesson was great as was the instruction itself. Juan was our instructor - not only was he helpful and knowledgeable but he's suuuper fun! He'll make you laugh while working with you on your technique. He helped us feel comfortable in water and after spending a couple hours with him, you can't help but feel a nice bond to the strong guy with the big heart who keeps you safe in the water and guarantees you'd catch a wave or two. Cheers to the best surfing school in LA - these guys are spectacular.< /text>

<name>Maggie Carson< /name><gmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//gmapID><Resp>None</Resp></record></dataset><record>
<userid>102546857415187669707< /userid><user_name>Bea Imrie</user_name><Time>1512013121162</Time>< rate>
5</rate>
< text>
If I could give these guys more than 5 stars I would!  I took a lesson here while visiting LA last week and cannot recommend them enough.  They were helpful when I texted them with questions ahead of time (on thanksgiving even!).
This review is going to be long, because I have so many good things to say!
The instructors we met were very friendly and welcoming as we got set up.  Raymond did our lesson, and explained everything clearly and gave us tips and pointers on our form before we even got into the water.  Once we started surfing he set us up for each wave, making sure our timing and speed was right so we could focus on popping up and balancing properly.  He gave us feedback on every wave, and both of us (first time surfers) were able to catch several waves by the end of the lesson.  We could see other lessons from Kapowui happening around us, and it seemed like the other lessons were equally successful. I have heard friends and family try other surfing schools who have given up after fruitless classes, and Kapowui made our experience completely the opposite.
We enjoyed the lesson so much that we went back to rent equipment from them a few days later.  Martin the owner was incredibly helpful; when we weren't sure if we should rent or take another lesson, he suggested we rent and if we changed our minds he would count our rental fee towards the lesson.  Martin was out surfing while we were, and gave us a bunch of pointers even though he had no obligation to.  It is clear he and all the Kapowui instructors are so passionate about surfing and teaching, and the joy they bring to it changes the lives of everyone who passes through.
You have converted two new surfers Kapowui! We are already planning our next trip back to venice to surf with you guys.  Thank you so much for sharing your passion!</text>

< rating>
5< /rating>
< Review>
My girlfriend and me were on a USA Roadtrip this Summer. On this trip we wanted to take our very first surf lesson, but we didn't manage to make reservations beforehand. So we thought this dream had to die.
But right before we left LA, we spontaneously stopped by at Kapowui Surf Lessons and although they were all booked out, they somehow made it possible for us to get our private lessons - instantly. This saved our day!
The instructor was very nice and really took his time explaining everything we needed to know. The lesson was very well structured and fun.
Even though it was my first time on a surfboard I managed to stand up on the board and ride the waves without falling down a couple times.
I don't remember the price, but I remember it to be very fair!
Definetely one of our trip's Highlights!</Review>

< Review>
I had sooo much fun this morning with Will!!! It was my first time surfing in my entire life, he was soo patient with me even though I kept on falling off the board, he continuously brought soo much energy and positivity with such clear communication on how to correct my form so I could stay upright on the board, and ultimately be able to ride the waves all the way to the end with comfort and confidence, which I did!!! Thanks to Will of course! I couldn't of been any happier with my experience from this morning!!! To anyone out there who wants to try out surfing but is intimidated that they will not be able to get the hang of it right away or not enjoy their surf lesson then you definitely need to check this place out! I promise you won't be disappointed, you'll have soo much fun, you'll love the environment, the clear communication from the instructors, how patient they are, the tremendous amount of positivity and energy they bring, and most importantly you'll definitely be able to learn how to surf if you continue having surf lessons with them! <UserId.>114406861253022673357</UserId.>< name>
Hailee Araya</name>
< date>
1503256905599<//date>
<Rating>5</Rating><text>Phenomenal group of instructors.
Me and my gal pal came to LA with intentions of only staying 5 days , then the plan was to go to Vegas for the remaining 5 days.
Long story short, we had our first lesson day 2 and by day 3 we had cancelled Vegas,  extended our stay in Venice beach,bought a package surfing  deal each so we could surf once a day everyday until it was time to head back.
My friend was a natural and was able to pop up on the board day 1.
Me , not so much. I kept trying and kept falling right into the water. Our first instructor Leon (who we had 4 sessions with) then made the observation that  i overshoot when I put my foot up when getting on the board.  I was too far up on the board when I popped up. So he said I'd need to be far back on the board ,more so than others since I have that habit of putting my leg to far forward. And whatddya know, suddenly I was balacing on that board! Amazing correction.
Our 2nd instructor Tod (we wanted to try as many instructors as possible to see what we could take from each one as everyone has their own style and methods) gave me the awesome advice to pop up on the board a bit faster and use my hands to balancs once im up so I'd stay on longer. Amazing feedback as that improved my balance greatly.
Will gave us gorgeous  waves and his ability to time them so they wouldn't be too overwhelming for us was impressive especially since the waves were massive when we went out for our lesson with him. He especially helped me with my fear of getting back into the water with my board which is honestly terrifying to me as I often felt like between the wind, water and sand (that would cement me in the ground) I felt I had little control over my board when getting back into the safe zone past the breaking waves.
I should say that every instructor addressed this fear with me and showed me how to get inside but I felt like I was able to spend more time making sure it stuck with Will in particular.

From day one till my last surfing session today (until I come back next month) myprogress is amazing and a true testament to how great these guys are at their jobs.
And as for my friend,  she's a natural....but can't swim very well. And they had her feeling so brave and taught her exactly how to protect herself in the water - this is a big deal for a girl who is scared of the water.

If you want to learn surfing , this is the group of people to go to. They're super fun, genuinely good people and VERY knowledgeable and skilled in their field.
They will take great care of you.
Thank you for everything guys, see you in September ‚ù§ x< /text><Pics>None</Pics><resp>None< /resp><GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//GmapID></record>
</dataset><record>

<user_id>102251668645351160786< /user_id>< name>
Pierre-Arnaud Dessaignes<//name>
<Date>1572403571458</Date><rate>5</rate><Text>Great teachers and good mood !</Text>< Pics>
None</Pics>
<Response>{'time': 1576267245382, 'text': 'Thank you for your review !'}< /Response><GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//GmapID></record>
</dataset><record>
<UserId.>116204073927605218053</UserId.>< review>
We were on an 8-day, 1700 mile whirlwind tour of California/Nevada last week with the family, when we were walking along Venice Beach in the morning before taking off for San Francisco. I was taking a picture of this very cool VW van with surfboards on it, when a guy came over and suggested we take surfing lessons. It put the spark in my partners mind, but i was a little more reserved.  It would completely round out the trip which included skiing in Heavenly, Lake Tahoe, hot springs in the Sierras, Death Valley and the High Roller in Vegas.  But, we didn't have a lot of time before heading to Alcatraz.

The guy, Blake, said he wouldn't be able to take us until later, because the tide was high, but to think about it and let him know if we were interested. We walked a bit, and the surf seemed huge! I never surfed before, and being from Nova Scotia, the waves seemed ginormous.

I was also a little unsure about a surfing outfit running out of a VW van on the beach. Seemed straight out of a novel or a movie. A bit unreal. Were there better options out there? So i took a minute to look through some reviews. Everything seemed good. Lots of great reviews for them, so i said why not?

Blake couldn't take us right away and we couldn't wait much longer because we had to get on the road, so one of the owner's, Marty came in special for us.  As a business owner, that in itself tells me that he's conscientious. And the equipment was clean and in great condition. The wetsuits were even on the top of the van warming up for us.

Then there was the dryland training. They made sure all of our group were ready for the water before we went out. Super safety conscious. Both of them were so positive and experienced that i felt totally safe. The waves were big, but they kept us all sorted out and motivated.  i even got up 5 times!!!

I really can't say enough about Kapowui. If i could give 10 stars out of 5, i would.  It's the real deal. If you are looking for an authentic surf experience at Venice Beach, Marty will give it to you. I'm so glad i took the plunge. It was the highlight of an already pretty epic adventure. Worth every penny!<//review>
